news_header: Advertisers are returning to the platform they previously boycotted, with Amazon planning significant investments in X advertising. Apple has resumed advertising on X after a year-long boycott.
news_original_title: Elon Musk aiheutti mainostajien joukkopaon viestipalvelu X:stä – USA:n presidentinvaalit näyttää kääntäneen trendin
news_text: The shift began after Elon Musk acquired the platform, previously known as Twitter, in late 2022. A notable drop in advertisers occurred in November 2023 due to Musk's controversial support for anti-Semitic messages. Companies like IBM, Disney, and Warner Bros have also returned after the US presidential election. However, some advertisers remain concerned about the platform's content and the rise of misinformation and hate speech. Musk has filed lawsuits against companies like Lego and Nestle for their advertising withdrawal, claiming significant financial losses due to their collective actions.
